intro: Neoporteria wagenknechtii var. vallenarensis, commonly known as the Vallenarensis Neoporteria, is a rare flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
